static gaia::locale::DateFormat gaia::text::DateFormat::getDateFormat ( const gaia::core::Context &  context) [static]

Returns a java.text.DateFormat object that can format the date in short form (such as 12/31/1999) according to the current localee and the user's date-order preference.

Parameters:
contextthe application context
Returns:
the java.text.DateFormat object that properly formats the date.

static bool gaia::text::DateFormat::is24HourFormat ( const gaia::core::Context &  context) [static]

Returns true if user preference is set to 24-hour format.

Parameters:
contextthe context to use for the content resolver
Returns:
true if 24 hour time format is selected, false otherwise.

Member Data Documentation

const char16_t gaia::text::DateFormat::AM_PM [static]

This designator indicates whether the HOUR field is before or after noon.

The output is lower-case.

Examples: a -> a or p aa -> am or pm

Definition at line 39 of file DateFormat.h.

const char16_t gaia::text::DateFormat::CAPITAL_AM_PM [static]

This designator indicates whether the HOUR field is before or after noon.

The output is capitalized.

Examples: A -> A or P AA -> AM or PM

Definition at line 49 of file DateFormat.h.

const char16_t gaia::text::DateFormat::DATE [static]

This designator indicates the day of the month.

Examples for the 9th of the month: d -> 9 dd -> 09

Definition at line 58 of file DateFormat.h.

const char16_t gaia::text::DateFormat::DAY [static]

This designator indicates the name of the day of the week.

Examples for Sunday: E -> Sun EEEE -> Sunday

Definition at line 67 of file DateFormat.h.

const char16_t gaia::text::DateFormat::HOUR [static]

This designator indicates the hour of the day in 12 hour format.

Examples for 3pm: h -> 3 hh -> 03

Definition at line 76 of file DateFormat.h.

const char16_t gaia::text::DateFormat::HOUR_OF_DAY [static]

This designator indicates the hour of the day in 24 hour format.

Example for 3pm: k -> 15

Examples for midnight: k -> 0 kk -> 00

Definition at line 88 of file DateFormat.h.

const char16_t gaia::text::DateFormat::MINUTE [static]

This designator indicates the minute of the hour.

Examples for 7 minutes past the hour: m -> 7 mm -> 07

Definition at line 97 of file DateFormat.h.

const char16_t gaia::text::DateFormat::MONTH [static]

This designator indicates the month of the year.

Examples for September: M -> 9 MM -> 09 MMM -> Sep MMMM -> September

Definition at line 108 of file DateFormat.h.

const char16_t gaia::text::DateFormat::QUOTE [static]

Text in the format string that should be copied verbatim rather that interpreted as formatting codes must be surrounded by the QUOTE character.

If you need to embed a literal QUOTE character in the output text then use two in a row.

Definition at line 116 of file DateFormat.h.

const char16_t gaia::text::DateFormat::SECONDS [static]

This designator indicates the seconds of the minute.

Examples for 7 seconds past the minute: s -> 7 ss -> 07

Definition at line 125 of file DateFormat.h.

const char16_t gaia::text::DateFormat::TIME_ZONE [static]

This designator indicates the offset of the timezone from GMT.

Example for US/Pacific timezone: z -> -0800 zz -> PST

Definition at line 134 of file DateFormat.h.

const char16_t gaia::text::DateFormat::YEAR [static]

This designator indicates the year.

Examples for 2006 y -> 06 yyyy -> 2006

Definition at line 143 of file DateFormat.h.
